intro: Dentella misera, commonly known as the lesser dentella, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, hairy leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and in wetlands. Dentella misera is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments, and it plays a role in supporting local insect populations.
